DOC.brief_summary: The limited research exist suggest lesbian , bisexual queer ( LBQ ) woman similar risk sexually transmit infection ( STI ) heterosexual woman . This particularly important area address , literature highlight convergence sexual stigma gender-based sexual violence elevate LBQ woman 's risk HIV STI infection . However , recent Statistics Canada data indicate : lesbian report significantly low rate Pap test heterosexual bisexual woman ; lesbians bisexual woman higher odds regular doctor heterosexual woman ; bisexual woman higher report unmet health care need lesbian heterosexual woman . These difference highlight importance implement evaluate intervention address STI risk among LBQ woman ; however , publish study exist nature . A STI prevention intervention implement group LBQ woman WSW Toronto Calgary . The study 5 distinct component : 1 ) key informant interview inform development intervention train manual survey questionnaire , 2 ) pre-test ; 3 ) intervention ( 6 group session weekend retreat ) ; 4 ) post-test directly follow intervention , 5 ) follow-up post-tests 6 12 week . The study hypothesis , compare pre-intervention , participant receive group-based intervention report increase sexually transmitted infection ( STI ) knowledge post-intervention . The secondary hypothesis , compare pre-intervention , participant demonstrate high mean score ( ) safer sex self-efficacy ; ( b ) STI test ; ( c ) safer sex practice ; ( ) resilient coping , ( e ) self-esteem , ( f ) social provision , ( g ) community connectedness ( h ) access health care . We anticipate compare pre-intervention , participant post-intervention would report low mean score ( ) depression ( b ) internalize stigma .
DOC.brief_title: A Group-level Intervention Reduce HIV/STI Risk Women Who Have Sex With Women Calgary Toronto
DOC.detailed_description: This single-centre pragmatic N-of-1 pilot study . The target population LBQ woman Calgary Toronto , Canada . The author aim recruit 40 participant use purposive peer-driven recruitment method . LBQ woman agency serve LBQ woman deliver intervention . A survey conduct pre post-intervention evaluate impact intervention . Paired-sample t-tests use assess pre- post- intervention difference sexual risk behaviour outcome ( safer sex practice , safe sex self-efficacy ) , protective factor ( resilient coping , HIV/STI knowledge test ) social-structural determinant ( social support , access health care , internalize sexual stigma ) directly follow intervention 3 month post-intervention . Logistic linear generalize estimate equation ( GEE ) regression model use assess intervention effect follow-up period 3 month control repeat within-subject measurement .
